item.title: 欧洲销量下滑，特斯拉市值跌破 1 万亿美元
item.description: 周二，特斯拉股价暴跌 8%，市值自 11 月以来首次跌破 1 万亿美元，此前数据显示这家电动汽车制造商 1 月份在欧洲的销量下滑。【原文：Tesla's stock tumbled 8% on Tuesday, pushing its market value below $1 trillion for the first time since November after data showed the electric car maker's sales slumped in Europe in January.】

item.title: Worldline 任命皮埃尔-安托万-江诗丹顿为首席执行官
item.description: 法国数字支付公司 Worldline 周二表示，已任命皮埃尔-安托万-瓦谢龙（Pierre-Antoine Vacheron）为首席执行官。【原文：French digital payments company Worldline has appointed Pierre-Antoine Vacheron as CEO, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴金不确定性要求对货币政策采取谨慎态度
item.description: 里士满联储主席汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）周二表示，他将对央行的利率政策采取观望态度，直到通胀率明确恢复到美联储 2% 的目标为止。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve President Tom Barkin said on Tuesday he will follow a wait-and-see approach regarding central bank interest rate policy until it is clear inflation is returning to the Fed's 2% target.】

item.title: 人工智能类股受挫，英伟达财报成败在此一举
item.description: 在人工智能风向标英伟达（Nvidia）发布季度财报之前，与人工智能相关的股票周二下跌。【原文：Artificial intelligence-linked shares fell on Tuesday, in lead-up to AI bellwether Nvidia's quarterly earnings, which could offer clarity on demand and justify the sector's lofty valuations.】

item.title: ASM 国际公司第四季度订单低于预期
item.description: 计算机芯片设备制造商 ASM International（ASMI）周二公布的第四季度订单低于分析师预期。【原文：Computer chip equipment maker ASM International (ASMI) reported fourth-quarter orders below analyst expectations on Tuesday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 Avtovaz 公司称雷诺俄罗斯回购计划至少耗资 13 亿美元
item.description: Avtovaz公司表示，如果法国汽车制造商雷诺希望回购其在俄罗斯顶级汽车制造商Avtovaz公司的多数股份，则必须支付至少1125亿卢布（13亿美元），以弥补自2022年以仅1卢布的价格出售股份以来所做的投资。【原文：Should French carmaker Renault wish to buy back its majority stake in Russia's top carmaker Avtovaz, it would have to pay at least 112.5 billion roubles ($1.3 billion) to cover investments made since selling for only one rouble in 2022, Avtovaz said.】

item.title: 消费者信心下滑，美联储将于 6 月恢复降息
item.description: 本周二，交易员们押注美联储很可能在6月份恢复降息，并可能在9月份再次降低短期借贷成本，因为他们考虑到了一项广受关注的调查的影响，该调查显示本月消费者信心下滑，通胀预期飙升。【原文：The Federal Reserve is likely to resume cutting interest rates in June and could reduce short-term borrowing costs again in September, traders bet on Tuesday as they took on board the implications of a widely watched survey that showed consumer confidence dove this month, and inflation expectations surged.】

item.title: 苹果投资者拒绝接受反对德意志投资公司政策的提议
item.description: 苹果公司股东在周二的投资者会议上否决了一项反对其多元化、公平和包容性政策的提案，在美国反对此类努力的声浪日益高涨之际，这家科技巨头取得了重大胜利。【原文：Apple shareholders rejected a proposal against its diversity, equity and inclusion policies at an investor meeting on Tuesday, handing a major victory to the tech giant as opposition against such efforts gains traction in the U.S.】

item.title: 独家：意大利将大型科技税收调查扩大到马斯克的 X 社交网络
item.description: 四位直接了解此事的消息人士称，意大利正在向埃隆-马斯克的社交网络 X 索赔 1250 万欧元（约合 1300 万美元）。【原文：Italy is claiming 12.5 million euros ($13 million) from Elon Musk's social network X following a tax probe running parallel to one into Meta , four sources with direct knowledge of the matter said, the latest move in a potential test case for the tech sector in Europe.】

item.title: 独家：国会美联储监督工作组组长计划对美国中央银行进行广泛审查
item.description: 众议员弗兰克-卢卡斯（Frank Lucas）计划对美国中央银行如何做出利率决定进行广泛审查，包括控制通胀是否应优先于保障就业。【原文：Representative Frank Lucas plans a broad review of how the US central bank makes its interest rate decisions, including whether controlling inflation should be prioritized over safeguarding employment.】

item.title: 谁是联合利华新任首席执行官费尔南多-费尔南德斯？
item.description: 消费集团联合利华周二出人意料地宣布，由财务总监费尔南多-费尔南德斯（Fernando Fernandez）接替首席执行官海因-舒马赫（Hein Schumacher），后者将承担重振消费集团业绩的艰巨任务。【原文：Consumer group Unilever surprised investors on Tuesday by replacing chief executive Hein Schumacher with finance chief Fernando Fernandez, who will take on the tough task of reviving the consumer group's performance.】

item.title: 国际投资基金（IIF）称，全球债务创历史新高，增加了债券守夜人的风险
item.description: 国际金融研究所（Institute of International Finance）周二发布的一份报告显示，去年全球债务与国内生产总值（GDP）之比自2020年以来首次上升，全球债务总额创下318万亿美元的年终新纪录，经济增长放缓。【原文：The global debt-to-GDP ratio rose for the first time since 2020 last year, as the world's debt stock hit a new year-end record of $318 trillion and economic growth slowed, an Institute of International Finance report showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国财政部贝森特：尽管指标合理，但美国经济 "底子薄弱
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二认为，美国经济的表象比经济指标所显示的更加脆弱，理由是利率波动、通胀胶着以及就业增长主要集中在政府部门。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday argued that the U.S. economy is more fragile under the surface than economic metrics suggest, citing interest rate volatility, sticky inflation and job growth focused on the government sector.】

item.title: 美国银行首席执行官预计美联储将维持利率不变，并敦促简化监管
item.description: 美国银行首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）周二表示，美国银行预计美联储今年和明年将保持利率稳定。【原文：Bank of America expects the Federal Reserve to hold interest rates steady this year and into next year, CEO Brian Moynihan said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 2 月份消费者信心急剧下降
item.description: 由于担心进口关税会抬高家庭物价，美国消费者信心在2月份出现了3年半以来的最大幅度下滑，12个月的通胀预期急剧上升。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence deteriorated at its sharpest pace in 3-1/2 years in February, with 12-month inflation expectations surging amid worries that tariffs on imports would raise prices for households.】

item.title: 美国铝业公司警告特朗普征收铝关税可能使美国失去 10 万个工作岗位
item.description: 铝业巨头美国铝业公司（Alcoa）周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对进口铝征收关税的计划可能会使全美损失约10万个工作岗位。【原文：Aluminum giant Alcoa said on Tuesday that U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to impose a tariff on aluminum imports could cost about 100,000 jobs across the United States.】

item.title: 欧洲人紧缩预算，TUI 希望吸引中国和美国度假者
item.description: TUI 高层管理人员表示，TUI 希望吸引中国和美国的度假者入住其在亚洲新建的酒店，并在东欧提供更便宜的旅游目的地，因为注重预算的欧洲人花费更少，预订的假期更短。【原文：TUI wants to attract holidaymakers from China and the United States to its new hotels in Asia and is offering cheaper destinations in eastern Europe as budget-conscious Europeans spend less and book shorter vacations, its top executive said.】

item.title: Sempra 因成本高企下调 2025 年利润预期，股价暴跌
item.description: 森普拉公司（Sempra）周二下调了 2025 年的利润预期，并对明年的盈利作出了低于华尔街预期的展望，因为这家公用事业公司表示，它面临着高成本的挑战。【原文：Sempra on Tuesday lowered its 2025 profit forecast and gave an outlook for earnings next year that was below Wall Street estimates, as the utility firm said it faced challenges with high costs.】

item.title: 欧洲顶级人工智能公司业绩继续下滑，微软数据中心忧虑未消
item.description: 周二，欧洲一些最受欢迎的人工智能相关股票连续第二天下跌，因为上周末的一份分析报告指出，微软在数据中心租赁方面可能放缓，这在英伟达（Nvidia）即将发布事关成败的财报之前打击了市场情绪。【原文：Some of Europe's most popular AI-linked stocks fell for a second day on Tuesday, after an analyst note late last week that flagged a possible slowdown by Microsoft on data centre leasing knocked sentiment ahead of make-or-break results from Nvidia .】

item.title: 微软投资云数据公司 Veeam Software，打造人工智能产品
item.description: 微软公司周二表示，已对 Veeam 软件公司进行了一笔未披露的股权投资，作为双方扩大合作以构建人工智能产品的一部分。【原文：Microsoft has made an undisclosed equity investment in Veeam Software as part of an expanded partnership to build artificial intelligence products, the cloud data company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 量子机器公司融资 1.7 亿美元，实现计算突破
item.description: 以色列量子机器公司（QM）的硬件和软件平台旨在加速实现实用量子计算机，该公司周二表示已筹集到 1.7 亿美元的中期资金。【原文：Israel's Quantum Machines (QM), whose hardware and software platform aims to accelerate the realization of practical quantum computers, said on Tuesday it had raised $170 million in mid-stage funding.】

item.title: 美国 12 月房价强劲上涨
item.description: 尽管供应量不断增加，但美国独户住宅的价格在 12 月份仍有稳健增长，加之抵押贷款利率上升，将继续削弱人们的承受能力。【原文：U.S. single-family house prices increased solidly in December, despite improving supply, which together with elevated mortgage rates will continue to erode affordability.】

item.title: Adobe 为手机带来免费 Photoshop 应用程序，吸引年轻用户
item.description: Adobe 公司周二表示，它将首次把 Photoshop 应用程序引入手机，提供免费版本和付费版本，最低费用为每月 7.99 美元。【原文：Adobe said on Tuesday it is bringing its Photoshop app to mobile phones for the first time, offering both a free version and a paid version at the lowest cost yet for the app, at $7.99 per month.】

item.title: 赛默飞世尔以 41 亿美元收购 Solventum 的纯化和过滤业务
item.description: 合同药品生产商赛默飞世尔科技公司周二表示，将以约 41 亿美元的价格收购 Solventum 公司的纯化和过滤业务。【原文：Contract drug manufacturer Thermo Fisher Scientific said on Tuesday it will buy Solventum's purification and filtration business for about $4.1 billion.】

item.title: 软件制造商 Dye & Durham 收到主动提出的 9.4 亿美元私有化要约
item.description: 加拿大软件制造商 Dye & Durham 周二表示，该公司收到了一份主动提出的私有化竞标，交易价值 13.4 亿加元，即每股 20 加元，但未透露竞标者的详细信息。【原文：Software maker Dye & Durham has received an unsolicited bid to take it private in a deal valued at C$1.34 billion, or C$20 per share, the Canadian company said on Tuesday, without disclosing the details of the bidder.】

item.title: 加拿大 1 月份工厂销售额很可能增长 2.0% - Statscan 预测
item.description: 2月25日（路透社）--加拿大统计局（Statistics Canada）在周二的初步估计中表示，加拿大1月份的工厂销售额很可能比12月份增长2.0%，这主要是受汽车工业集团以及初级金属子行业销售额增长的推动。【原文：Feb 25 (Reuters) - Canadian factory sales most likely rose 2.0% in January from December, largely driven by higher sales in motor vehicle industry group, as well as the primary metal subsectors, Statistics Canada said in a flash estimate on Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，联合利华董事会一致决定解雇首席执行官舒马赫
item.description: 一位熟悉联合利华董事会想法的消息人士告诉路透社，包括亿万富翁激进投资者纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）在内的联合利华董事会一致决定罢免首席执行官海因-舒马赫（Hein Schumacher）。【原文：Unilever's board, which includes billionaire activist investor Nelson Peltz, was unified in its decision to oust CEO Hein Schumacher, a source familiar with the board's thinking told Reuters.】

item.title: 特斯拉将收购德国零部件制造商 Manz 的部分资产
item.description: 美国汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）周二表示，将收购破产的德国高科技零部件制造商曼兹公司（Manz AG）的部分股权，其中包括该公司位于德国西南部罗伊特林根市（Reutlingen）工厂的 300 多名员工。【原文：U.S. carmaker Tesla will acquire parts of the insolvent German high-tech parts maker Manz AG , including more than 300 employees at its site in Reutlingen city in the southwest, the German company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 博茨瓦纳与德比尔斯公司签署拖延已久的钻石协议
item.description: 博茨瓦纳政府周二与英美资源集团（Anglo American）旗下的戴比尔斯公司（De Beers）签署了一项拖延已久的钻石销售协议，并表示希望该协议能在博茨瓦纳经济低迷之际创造就业机会。【原文：Botswana's government on Tuesday signed a long-delayed diamonds sales agreement with Anglo American unit De Beers, saying it hoped it would create jobs at a time when the economy is in a slump.】

item.title: Arc'teryx 所有者 Amer Sports 认为今年销售增长放缓
item.description: 体育用品集团 Amer Sports 周二发布第四季度业绩报告称，受旗下昂贵品牌 Arc'teryx 的推动，该公司在 2024 年强劲增长后，今年的销售额增长将有所下降。【原文：Sportswear group Amer Sports sees lower sales growth this year after a strong 2024, the company said on Tuesday as it reported fourth-quarter results boosted by its expensive Arc'teryx brand.】
